org.hs.generator
Class GArrayAccess

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.hs.generator.GConstruct
        |
        +--org.hs.generator.GArrayAccess
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, org.hs.util.Copy, org.hs.generator.GExpression, at.dms.compiler.PhylumListener, java.io.Serializable
public class GArrayAccess
extends org.hs.generator.GConstruct
implements org.hs.generator.GExpression

GArrayAccess represents an expression in which a base expression of array type is accessed with square brackets, e.g.:
int[] numbers = new int[] {0,1,2,3,4,5}; System.err.println(numbers[3]); // a GArrayAccess represents 'numbers[3]'

Multi-dimensional arrays are represented with nested GArrayAccess expressions, such that the field array of one GArrayAccess is itself a GArrayAccess.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

array

public org.hs.generator.GExpression array
The array field represents the base of the array access expression, and hence must evaluate to an array type. Considering the example above, the local variable numbers would be an appropriate value for this field.

index

public org.hs.generator.GExpression index
The index field represents the index within square brackets. Considering again the example above, the constant value 3 represents the index in that GArrayAccess expression.
